answer:
You can contact your local public health unit to find out which vaccines you are eligible for. A public health nurse can review your immunization records and blood work results, tell you which vaccines are recommended for you, and let you know which vaccines are publicly funded (free) and available from the health unit.  
Immunization Nurse
answer_formatted:
## You can contact your local public health unit to find out which vaccines you are eligible for.

A public health nurse can review your immunization records and blood work results, tell you which vaccines are recommended for you, and let you know which vaccines are publicly funded (free) and available from the health unit.
Immunization Nurse
question: Hello, I need to submit an immunization record to my school, and it seems like some of antibodies I have are weak, so I was wondering where I could get vaccinated. Thank you!
